poem:
Title: Plight of Gaza

In the hush of the city,
Beneath the indifferent stars, 
Voices echo, harsh 
And hollow. 

New Zealand's heart, afar,
Pleads for our shared humanity,
To thaw the cold hands 
Of dividend diplomacy.

Gaza's children,
Innocent in iron cast,
Await our mercy east,
A world removed from west.
 
To the deafening silence,
Fear not; the turtle dove
Can hear your call,
And flights to freedom above.
